intro: Nigella sativa var. brachyloba, commonly known as the Persian cowpea or love in a bottle, is a variant of the black cumin plant. It is a herbaceous annual that produces small, spherical seed pods containing numerous tiny, dark seeds. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. Its flowers are pale yellow to white, and the plant is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia. The seeds are valued for their aromatic properties and have been used in traditional medicine for their potential health benefits.
